channel.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account
channel.description:
I know some people bought a few accounts, so if any of those people happen to be members here is anyone interested in donating/selling an MC account to a friend of mine. I'll purchase through MY paypal so it's safe.
If you do want to sell one - PM me or contact me on IRC (often AFK-wait for a response), since buying/selling on the forum is technically against the rules.
Not interested in beta accounts, alpha or pre-alpha only please.
He's not interested in paying a fortune either <=£10

item.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

are there any other alpha ones for sale? im still interested in getting one

Read full topic

Just been waiting on friend to give me a tenner to credit my paypal with.

item.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:379695”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=475537.msg3480140#msg3480140 date=1296046802]

It has always said that ‘you purchase the game as it is now, no guarantees of future anything’, but ‘as an added bonus, future updates will be given to you’.

Nowhere in that do I read that if you buy the beta, you get the final game but no updates after that.

The part you highlighted only refers to the discount, meaning that the price goes up as the game gets better.
[/quote]If you had been following the blog, you’d know that me and sppt are correct. (I’m too lazy to dig it up)

Or read any of the forums.

http://notch.tumblr.com/post/2175441966/minecraft-beta-december-20-2010

Thanks for finally posting a link. I don’t “follow” anything, so I didn’t see it.

Still, his post says you will get the final version and always get bug fixes and such, you may not get optional expansions for free. Still pretty much the same.[/quote]

Not quite. That’s like, users who preorder getting ALL DLC in the future for free, it’s a big deal.

Me, with an alpha account, will get any expansion for free. Anyone else with a newer account will have to pay if and when there are expansions. So Notch&Co add a lot of new features and bundle it for $15 more. I don’t pay anything and download it immediately. Other people can choose to pay or not to play with the new features.

Read full topic

It has always said that ‘you purchase the game as it is now, no guarantees of future anything’, but ‘as an added bonus, future updates will be given to you’.

Nowhere in that do I read that if you buy the beta, you get the final game but no updates after that.

The part you highlighted only refers to the discount, meaning that the price goes up as the game gets better.
[/quote]If you had been following the blog, you’d know that me and sppt are correct. (I’m too lazy to dig it up)

Or read any of the forums.

http://notch.tumblr.com/post/2175441966/minecraft-beta-december-20-2010[/quote]

Still, his post says you will get the final version and always get bug fixes and such, you may not get optional expansions for free. Still pretty much the same.

item.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It has always said that ‘you purchase the game as it is now, no guarantees of future anything’, but ‘as an added bonus, future updates will be given to you’.

Nowhere in that do I read that if you buy the beta, you get the final game but no updates after that.

The part you highlighted only refers to the discount, meaning that the price goes up as the game gets better.

item.source: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account

item.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:8, topic:379695”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=475537.msg3479150#msg3479150 date=1295951992]

99% sure he said that beta will still get all future content.
[/quote]Wrong. Beta accounts will get the final release, but not any future content beyond that. Alpha accounts will however get that.

I don’t think that is right either, can you link to proof?

[quote=http://www.minecraft.net/copyright.jsp]
What you get for purchasing
Please note that Minecraft is currently a work in progress and NOT a finished product! The sandbox mode available right now. However, you may buy a discounted beta account today, which will also include the full game!

As we at Mojang continue to release more complete builds of the game, we will also be reducing the discount gradually until we reach the final version and full price of the product. So the earlier you buy, the better value you get! Although we are very passionate about this project, we cannot guarantee that it will be completed - that’s why we offer the discounted price When you purchase the game, you pay for it as it is right now. Future updates are an added bonus.[/quote]

That says you get the full game and future updates, and that is for the beta. I’m pretty sure it has always been worded like that.[/quote]
Are you stupid and blockheaded?
Beta accounts will receive the final BASE game, without future expansions.

Read full topic
item.source: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account

item.title: Friend looking to acquire a Minecraft Alpha account
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:6, topic:379695”][quote author=Cruzer link=topic=475537.msg3478653#msg3478653 date=1295910788]
99% sure he said that beta will still get all future content.
[/quote]Wrong. Beta accounts will get the final release, but not any future content beyond that. Alpha accounts will however get that.[/quote]

I don’t think that is right either, can you link to proof?

What you get for purchasing Please note that Minecraft is currently a work in progress and NOT a finished product! The sandbox mode available right now. However, you may buy a discounted beta account today, which will also include the full game!

As we at Mojang continue to release more complete builds of the game, we will also be reducing the discount gradually until we reach the final version and full price of the product. So the earlier you buy, the better value you get! Although we are very passionate about this project, we cannot guarantee that it will be completed - that’s why we offer the discounted price When you purchase the game, you pay for it as it is right now. Future updates are an added bonus.

That says you get the full game and future updates, and that is for the beta. I’m pretty sure it has always been worded like that.

Read full topic
